definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The Philosophy Department of Nankai University is one of the important bases for fostering philosophical talents.
sentences.chinese: 南開大學哲學系是全國哲學人才培養基地之一。

sentences.english: Editing Group for Experimental Animal Anatomy of Nankai University.
sentences.chinese: 南開大學實驗動物解剖學編寫組。

sentences.english: The process of the development of Nankai university virtual digital campus system was given in detail in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 詳細介紹了南開大學虛擬數字校園系統的開發過程。

sentences.english: Zhang Boling was the creator of Nankai University.
sentences.chinese: 張伯苓是南開大學的創建者。

sentences.english: Please take me to Shiing-shen Building at Nankai University.
sentences.chinese: 請載我去天津市南開大學省身樓。

sentences.english: Nankai University is well-known around the world as a comprehensive university.
sentences.chinese: 南開大學作爲一個綜合大學在國際上享有盛譽。

sentences.english: The debate next week is Nankai University versus Peking University.
sentences.chinese: 下個星期的辯論賽是南開大學對北京大學。
